data.title: Starting half window with specific project
data.body: - atom --version Atom : 1.7.2 Electron: 0.36.8 Chrome : 47.0.2526.110 Node : 5.1.1 - os version osx 10.11.4 1. I tried to open specific named project but it never goes with full window but another project are fine when open. 2. I tried to launch on the safe(-safe) mode but nothing change. 3. I tried to delete .atom directory but still same problem (actually, _$ mv .atom atom_bak_ then re-launch) 4. I changed specific directory name then it works but I do not want to change directory name. 5. I couldn't find any specific settings for the project.

data.title: Fix infinite recursion in GitRepositoryAsync
data.body: Introduced in https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11562.

data.title: git not interfacing with Atom correctly
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [**Yes**] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [**Yes**] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [**Yes**] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [**Yes**] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [**I think so**] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [**Yes**] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

'm a new user of Atom and Git. I've configured git to use Atom as its core editor. Mostly Atom works for me; and mostly, git works for me. Together, they aren't happy.

Atom is configured as the editor in this manner: git config --global core.editor "'C:/users/[user]/appdata/local/atom/bin/atom.cmd' --new-window --wait"

I've also tried it without the "--new-window" flag, with no difference in result.

When I issue a "git commit" command, I get some form of the following, IF THERE'S NO CURRENT
INSTANCE OF ATOM:

```
App load time: 545ms
[1228:0424/183520:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[1228:0424/183520:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[1228:0424/183520:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[1228:0424/183520:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[1228:0424/183522:INFO:CONSOLE(52)] "Window load time: 1483ms", source: file:///C:/Users/[user]/AppData/Local/atom/app-1.7.2/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (52)
[1228:0424/183525:INFO:CONSOLE(1282)] "Error refreshing repository status:", source: C:\Users[user]\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.7.2\resources\app.asar\src\git-repository-async.js (1282)
[1228:0424/183525:INFO:CONSOLE(1283)] "Error: Reference 'refs/heads/master' not found", source: C:\Users[user]\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.7.2\resources\app.asar\src\git-repository-async.js (1283)
[1228:0424/183525:INFO:CONSOLE(392)] "Uncaught (in promise) Error: Reference 'refs/heads/master' not found", source: node.js (392)
[1228:0424/183526:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "::shadow pseudo-element is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source: (0)
error: There was a problem with the editor ''C:/users/[user]/appdata/local/atom/bin/atom.cmd' --new-window --wait'.
Please supply the message using either -m or -F option.
```

If there IS ALREADY a current instance of Atom, then instead I get this:

```
App load time: 815ms
error: There was a problem with the editor ''C:/users/[user]/appdata/local/atom/bin/atom.cmd' --new-window --wait'.
Please supply the message using either -m or -F option.
```

In neither case does the commit succeed.

I don't know whether the "-m" or "-F" option would solve the problem, but if it will I'm not sure how to supply one of those.

I've done very little configuration with git and Atom, so they're both very close to "out of the box" with regard to customization.

Can anyone help?

-boster
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Configure Atom as the default editor for git, in gitbash, with this line of code:

```
git config --global core.editor "'C:/users/[user]/appdata/local/atom/bin/atom.cmd' --new-window --wait"
```
1. Commit a change to a repository

**Expected behavior:** 
I expect an Atom window to open with git commit details, and a place for me to enter a commit message. Upon closing this Atom window, I expect the commit to be executed and succeed.

**Actual behavior:** 
The Atom window does open, and I edit my message and close the window. But instead of executing the commit, the commit fails.
### Versions

**From apm --version:**
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.8.1.windows.1
visual studio

**From Windows command ver:**
Windows 10.0.10586

**From atom --version:**
Atom 1.7.2
Electron 0.36.8
Chrome 47.0.2526.110
Node 5.1.1

data.title: Remove TextEditor's dependency on ViewRegistry
data.body:
_:warning: Dependent on https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/11603 :warning:_

This is step 3 as laid out by @nathansobo in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10979.

Remove `TextEditor`s dependency on `ViewRegistry`.

data.title: Remove TextEditor's dependency on PackageManager
data.body:
This is step 2 as laid out by @nathansobo in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10979.

Remove `TextEditor`s dependency on `PackageManager`.

data.title: Remove TextEditor's dependency on NotificationManager
data.body:
This is step 1 as laid out by @nathansobo in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10979.

Remove `TextEditor`s dependency on `NotificationManager`.

data.title: tree view not working
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Y ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ Y] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ Y] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [Y ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ Y] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ Y] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

tree view not toggling with ctrl-\ or ctrl-shift-p
### Steps to Reproduce
1. open atom in a directory
2. try to toggle tree view with ctrl-\
3. try to toggle tree view with ctrl-shift-p

**Expected behavior:** tree view to open and close

**Actual behavior:** unresponsive
### Versions

Windows version 7

Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.4.windows.1
visual studio 2013

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Atom crashes when trying to open an extremely large file (>2GB in this case)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom crashes after opening extremely large files (>2GB in my case).
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open extremely large file with atom
2. press proceed on warning
3. watch as atom crashes

**Expected behavior:** 

Atom opens file and shows text

**Actual behavior:** 

Atom attempts to open file and crashes almost immediately 
### Versions

1.7.2

### Description

Everytime I try to open any panel, atom crashes with the "The editor has crashed" dialog.

Which crash report should I include here?
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open atom
2. Open anything, a file, the settings, etc.
3. Recieve the crash dialog.

**Expected behavior:** To not crash

**Actual behavior:** Crash

Electron: 0.36.8

npm  2.13.3

data.title: Atom doesn't open. Error: Module version mismatch. Expected 47, got 46.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported??
### Description

I've updated Atom to the last version and it doesn't open. Instead of it, when I tried to open Atom it opens like the web console of Firefox where I can see all the HTML elements and use debugger. I believe it is the debugging tool of Atom.

I am using an Arch Linux distribution and I built myself Atom for the installation. In other words, I downloaded the git repository and built Atom.

Attached is the log.

data.title: Atom wants to connect to **keep.google.com** on port 443
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description When launching Atom, LittleSnitch reports that: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Launch Atom 2. See LittleSnitch dialog **Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen] Atom doesn't connect to keep.google.com, so there's no LittleSnitch dialog. **Actual behavior:** [What actually happened] Atom attempts connecting to keep.google.com, so LittleSnitch displays a dialog. ### Versions You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running. ``` $ atom --version Atom : 1.7.2 Electron: 0.36.8 Chrome : 47.0.2526.110 Node : 5.1.1 $ apm --version apm 1.9.2 npm 2.13.3 node 0.10.40 python 2.7.10 git 2.6.4 ``` OS X 10.11.4 (15E65)

data.title: memory leak when alt-tabbing (most likely only with .atom added to the tree view)
data.body:
windows 7, single - small - file opened.

when alt-tabbing, going back to atom causes a spike in cpu and memory usage - memory gets allocated, deallocated, it looks like something is going on, and sometimes there's a little bit less allocated after that, but more often than not - more. after a few moments of alt-tabbing, 150mb turns into 300mb, after a while - into over 1gb of ram, used for nothing.

heap profiling shows constant 42mb. safe mode - same thing. looks like a bug.

latest stable version, everything checked. and i'm just updating this issue, because i've found one little important detail - the problem occurs when one (of two in my case) folders added to the tree view is .atom - it doesn't matter if the tree view is hidden. after removing .atom from the tree view, memory leak doesn't happen. there's a small cpu spike but nothing that major, and there's no major memory allocation change. weird.

data.title: Atom v1.7.2 Crashes Very Frequently on Windows 10 x64
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Windows 10 x64, Atom v1.7.2 (installed with the Windows installer)

Atom started to crash VERY frequently for me, almost every hour, when I'm regularly typing in the editor. It started to happen recently, either 1.7.2 or 1.7.1 version. I use Atom for at least 5 hours a day so I'm seeing this 4-5 times a day.

I have two different Windows 10 x64 machines and this started to happen simultaneously in both machines. Both have 16GB memory and I never use more than 50% of it. Intel i5-3340M & i7-2600 processors. I tried uninstalling & re-installing several times which didn't fix this issue (cleaned .atom folder too, except for the `config.cson` and `packages` folder).

See crash logs from `AppData\Local\Temp\Atom Crashes\operation_log.txt` here: https://gist.github.com/tedyun/2525fbefcdf1f68e82594d419ca37554
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use Atom v1.7.2 for a while on Windows 10 x64.
2. Editor crashes almost every hour when I'm regularly typing in the editor.

**Expected behavior:** Should not crash that often.

**Actual behavior:** Crashes frequently.
### Versions

`atom --version`
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

`apm --version`
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0.windows.1
visual studio

Windows 10 x64

data.title: Moving mouse selects text between cursor and mouse position
data.body:
Atom 1.7.2 on Ubuntu 15.04

Anybody experiencing the same problem when editing a text file? I have my cursor e.g. position in line 10 and when I move the cursor to 12 all text between line 10 and 12 are selected. This makes it very hard using Atom :(.

data.title: Quadruple Atom taking up 1.2GB!
data.body:
I just realized I have four Atoms on my system gobbling up more than a gigabyte!

Two of them are in the `\AppData\Local\atom`. These I was aware of — still see no good reason for Atom to do that, also almost no other apps do that, but oh well.
But then I've discovered another double-Atom buried in the `\AppData\Local\SquirrelTemp` in nondescript "tempb" and "tempe" folders.
That's just ridiculous. With such a bad installation/upgrade design I'd rather go back to clicking one UAC prompt per upgrade rather than having the silent "convenience" of quadruple app!

Is there an option somewhere that I could enable to get rid of all this unnecessary quadruplication and go back to having just one and only one app — the latest version I'm using?
Thank you

Windows 10 x64
Atom versions app-1.6.2 and app-1.5.3 (plus whatever versions are left in the Squirrel folder)

data.title: Add native OS X Notifications
data.body: Several times a notifications pops up in Atom, I miss reading it in it's entirety, and I think adding the notifications to the native OS X notifications bar would be great and more streamlined.

data.title: Where are bundled APM packages installed on Linux and how to install extra packages there?
data.body:
Hi,

I would like to create an AUR package to install Atom and the `package-sync` package of Lee Dohm, as it would simplify the process of installing the packages one wants, if one regularly switches between Arch Linux installations. It would pull in the `atom-editor` package as a required dependency and then, when building the package, run some command to install the `package-sync` package. AUR packages are usually better off installing packages to one's `/usr` directory than to one's home directory the way that apm does by default. For example, Node packages in the AUR use the `/usr` directory and packages are installed there using the command:

``` bash
npm install --user root -g --prefix $pkgdir/usr $_npmname@$pkgver
```

so it would help me to know where the APM packages that come bundled with Atom are installed to, by default, on Linux platforms. I have tried searching the contents of Atom Linux binary packages for such a location but I can't find one, so I assume there is something I am missing. Plus, please tell me how I might specify the install location for APM packages, analogously to how the `--prefix` flag does for NPM packages. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Atom don't remove file in typescript project.
data.body: Hi, I use atom for typescript development but atom can't deleting file or directory in project on windows and mac os. I observed this problem specific only typescript projects. Atom hasn't this bug for other projects.

data.title: tree-view fails to show git-status changes on OSX
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom 1.7.2 on OSX does not show tree-view git status changes
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Atom
2. Open Atom
3. Add project folder that includes git repositories

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
4. Look at tree-view and see summarized git status  (orange for modified, green for added, etc)

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
4. Look at tree-view and see no colors
### Versions

atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

OS Info:
     System Version: OS X 10.11.3 (15D21)
      Kernel Version: Darwin 15.3.0

Screenshot:
![screen shot 2016-04-22 at 4 29 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1039884/14757660/ca7f73ac-08aa-11e6-9e88-29ab95d667a5.png)

data.title: Use an async dialog box
data.body:
This way we don't block the main process until the dialog box is closed.  I'm not sure that this actually works - I experienced Atom hanging once with this branch built but didn't receive a dialog.

(See http://electron.atom.io/docs/v0.37.7/api/dialog/#dialogshowmessageboxbrowserwindow-options-callback for the notes about sync/async)

Fixes #11551

data.title: Makes script/build experience better for Windows users.
data.body:
This does two things:
1. Changes the default install folder to better match atomsetup.exe location, e.g. `c:\users\bob\appdata\local\atom\app-dev\` instead of `c:\program files\atom`
2. Only requests Admin rights if it can't write to the target instead of always prompting UAC

data.title: Copy/paste lag causes previous clipboard to be pasted when using "find" field
data.body:
### Description

If do the steps below fast enough, it pastes the _previous_ clipboard contents instead of the new one.

In other words, there's a lag before anything copied ends up on the clipboard. If I wait slightly after `cmd-F`, it pastes the correct thing. The same lag does not occur within a single editor; only when copying from the editor and into another buffer, in this case the "find" field.

Here's a video ([mp4](https://www.dropbox.com/s/9iut1241xq5gl8f/atom.mp4?dl=0)). It's slowed down to 1/10 of the real speed and shows me copying the word "key" and pasting it, which ends up being "position", which wasn't what I copied. (Please ignore the fact when the "find" panel is shown intially, it contains the word "key". That's from a previous attempt. Had to do this a bunch of times to reproduce in a way that was understandable in a video.)

![atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/14751466/ffb107ba-0897-11e6-9025-a093af078c79.gif)

It's super annoying because I work very fast, and this has started hitting me constantly. I believe the lag only showed up in 1.7.x, which I recently upgraded to.

I don't have any keymap stuff that should interfere here.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Select text.
2. Hit `cmd-C` to copy.
3. Hit `cmd-F` to find.
4. Hit `cmd-V` to paste.

**Expected behavior:** Selected text to be pasted.

**Actual behavior:** Previous contents of the clipboard is pasted. If I wait a little bit, pasting pastes the correct content.
### Versions

```
# atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

OS X 10.11.4.

data.title: Stylesheet ignoring certain attributes
data.body:
### Description

I'm using the **Spacegray Dark Neue** for both UI and Syntax. For `.yaml` files, it has a css rule:

``` css
.entity.name.tag {
  text-decoration: underline;
  color: #cc6666;
}
```

I'm trying to change the `text-decoration` value to `none`, but adding that change to my stylesheet does not affect my file. I've also added other things in order to get any kind of response, like `background-color` or another text color, but again, those changes are not loaded. **The rest of my stylesheet loads fine**.

**Expected behavior:** `text-decoration` value should be `none`

**Actual behavior:** Not a single change to the `.entity.name.tag` selector is working-
### Versions

Atom             : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
OS X: 10.11.4
